item.title: 5 Reasons to use an IDE Instead of an Editor
item.description: The word *editor* and IDE (integrated development environments) are often mistakenly used interchangeably. However, there are some big differences between the two. The extra functionality you get with an IDE can provide significant time savings [...]

item.title: Chrome Debugging in Komodo X, Code and Debug in One Place
item.description: Let me set the stage: You are a web developer. You spend many hours a week writing javascript, running javascript and debugging javascript. You're very adept at it, you write your code, fire up a web server and point Chrome at it [...]

item.title: Komodo X Released - It's 10X Better
item.description: The moment is finally here, Komodo X (10) is released and it's like 10 times better! The pun sounded so horrible when I came up with it, I just had to use it. But it really is a LOT better [...]

item.title: Help Us Test Komodo IDE 10 and We'll Give You $50
item.description: As you may have heard, we released our Komodo 10 alpha last week so the community can help us run it through its paces. We've already received a ton of helpful bug reports but we want MORE [...]

item.title: Komodo 10 Alpha Pre-release Now Available
item.description: Releasing an alpha/beta of your product is like showing everyone your new baby. Everyone is excited, but he's still very fragile, and you're scared someone might look at them the wrong way. Komodo 10 has come a long way [...]

item.title: Komodo Toolbox
item.description: The Komodo toolbox is where you can store all of your custom tools such as code snippets and abbreviations, userscripts, commands, etc. The fresh Komodo install comes with a huge selection of tools and snippets already installed [...]

item.title: Go-to-Definiton
item.description: Komodo Go to Definition is a helpful tool to quickly see the definition of any construct in your code. Whether it's a function, a variable, a class, class member or global [...]

item.title: Configuring Komodo
item.description: Komodo has been written with the concept of "make the best guess then allow custom changes". For 90% of Komodo features, you should simply be able to start Komodo and use it, and it will just work. At start up [...]

item.title: Smart Snippets
item.description: Komodo snippets and abbreviations are nothing new to code editing (they've been in Komodo almost since the beginning 15 years ago). But something that Komodo has that others may not...smart snippets [...]

item.title: Komodo Quick Bookmarks
item.description: Komodo's quick bookmarks are a logical extension of the existing bookmarks. They were implemented, once again, with our users' speed and concentration in mind. They allow you to very quickly navigate to and from points of interest in your code [...]

item.title: Komodo File Management
item.description: Komodo, as it should, provides robust tools to work with your projects files. The first is Komodo's Places pane. Places allows you to easily perform file specific function (eg. contextual SCC commands, publishing commands, copy/paste/cut/delete, etc [...]

item.title: Track Changes: For Programmers Who Sometimes Make Mistakes
item.description: As you may well be aware, I am an excellent programmer. What you may not be aware of is that I SOMETIMES make mistakes. When one of these most uncommon events occur [...]

item.title: Code Intelligence in Komodo
item.description: All of our main languages like, Python, PHP, Ruby, Perl, Javascript, NodeJS, Go, Tcl and HTML, among others have code intelligence support. Not only does this mean that you get code intelligence for native language functions, classes [...]

item.title: Komodo's Commando Tool
item.description: Komodo's Commando tool is a workhorse in Komodo. Through the Commando window you can access all of Komodo's internal commands, all toolbox items, open any file on your computer, find code symbols related to your file and project, etc [...]

item.title: Komodo Packages
item.description: In Komodo we have a concept of Packages. A package is any external item that can be added to Komodo [...]
